Name: Ujjayanta Palace, Agartala (Tripura)
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, wheelchair accessible inside museum
Special Notes: Houses Tripura State Museum; Indo-Saracenic architecture; evening illumination enhances view.

Name: Neermahal, Melaghar (Tripura)
Nearest Airport: Maharaja Bir Bikram Airport, Agartala – ~55 km
Accessibility: Road access, boats required to reach palace; not fully wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Local guides available at palace and boating point
Nearby Amenities: Lodges in Melaghar, eateries, shops, restrooms
Special Notes: “Lake Palace of Tripura”, Indo-Islamic architecture, famous for Neermahal Water Festival.

Name: Tripura Sundari Temple, Udaipur (Tripura)
Accessibility: Well-paved road; temple steps not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local priests and guides explain temple history
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, dharamshalas, shops, food stalls, restrooms
Special Notes: One of 51 Shakti Peethas; locally called “Matabari”; big Diwali fair attracts lakhs of pilgrims.

Name: Sepahijala Wildlife Sanctuary, Bishalgarh (Tripura)
Type: Wildlife Sanctuary / Zoo / Botanical Garden / Eco-Tourism
Accessibility: Good roads; internal paths partly rough; not fully wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Forest guest house, restaurants, tea stalls, restrooms
Special Notes: Famous for clouded leopard; boating on Amrit Sagar lake; botanical gardens; picnic spot.

Name: Jampui Hills, North Tripura (Tripura)
Accessibility: Hilly roads; not wheelchair-friendly; some trekking paths
Special Notes: “Seat of eternal spring”; orange festival; sunrise and sunset points.

Name: Unakoti, Kailashahar (North Tripura, Tripura)
Accessibility: Forested trail; uneven terrain; not wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Guest houses, eateries, restrooms in Kailashahar
Special Notes: Ancient rock-carved faces and idols; legend of “one less than a crore” (99,99,999 idols).

Name: Dumboor Lake, Amarpur (Tripura)
Accessibility: Motorable roads; boating needed to explore islands
Nearby Amenities: Guest houses, small eateries, shops, restrooms
Special Notes: 48 islands; Pous Sankranti festival at Tirthamukh; birdwatching paradise.

Name: Deotamura (Chabimura), Gomati District (Tripura)
Accessibility: Boat ride along Gomati River; trekking required; not wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Small shops, restrooms, lodges in Udaipur
Special Notes: Rock carvings of Hindu deities on steep mountain walls; scenic river cruise.

Name: Tepania Eco-Park, Udaipur (Tripura)
Accessibility: Good roads; internal park trails, partly uneven; limited wheelchair facilities
Special Notes: Tree house, hanging bridge, eco-tourism cottages.

Name: Baramura Eco-Park, Khowai District (Tripura)
Nearest Bus Stand: Local bus stand at Baramura – ~3 km
Accessibility: Road access; hilly terrain; limited wheelchair access
Special Notes: Surrounded by Baramura Hills; scenic green forest park; quiet environment.

Name: Pilak Archaeological Site, Belonia (South Tripura)
Accessibility: Good roads; flat terrain; partially wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Available via Archaeological Survey of India (ASI)
Nearby Amenities: Small shops, local guest houses, restrooms
Special Notes: 8th–9th century Buddhist and Hindu stone sculptures; part of Buddhist circuit.
